content: Very good noise blocking for the price, and the sound fidelity is also good as is the clarity.  Have not tested the microphone yet.

author: Olga
title: Good quality headphones
content: I go through headphones pretty fast but I have those for couple of months now and they are very good quality,  I like how the cord is easy to untangle and they are still working, being thrown without any protection in my purse.

author: Keke Lea
title: Weighty earbuds
content: These earbuds have good sound but I do not care for the weight. They are a little heavier than usual earbuds and fall out of my ears more often than others.

author: Sumaria
title: Product As Described and Priced Right
content: I just received these earbuds and they didn't disappoint. They are just as described as far as excellent sound quality, noise cancellation and bass quality for my LGV40.  I wanted earbuds that would be superior to match my phone and these didn't disappoint. Also being able to control the sound with the up/down feature on the left side of the ear bud is also nice.  I will be purchasing another pair for Christmas gifts. I highly recommend purchasing.

author: Julia
title: They were amazing!! Until they weren't...
content:
I got these about 6 months ago, they where amazing!!!  But now the left speaker tends to cut out (why I'm only giving 4 stars).  But when they both work the sound quality is still solid!

Update:  What is with the left speaker?  I got a second pair of these and again, they worked great!  Until they didn't.  the left speaker went out again!  I was looking at some reviews of their other products and every review that I could find that had trouble with the speakers only had a problem with the left side.  I don't get it.  They worked well for about a year.  I'm ok cause I got them on sale, but if I spent $40 on these I would want them to last longer.

author: ju$tin
title: these r pretty suck
content: fall out of my ears with the slightest movement would have returned but u know how annoying it is to return something that costs 10$ that u bought on the internet i don't got time for that

author: Laurene P.
title: My son is happy.
content:
I purchased them for my son. He says they work well, and he likes the bass. He does still have issues with them tangling, but otherwise is happy with them.

Update: I purchased these in August and already they aren't working. The sound goes in and out, and there is a raspy sound. This is my second pair. author: Alex Taylor
title: They seemed really sturdy and have a good sound quality
content: I've only had these for a little over a month and one of the buds already stopped working. They seemed really sturdy and have a good sound quality. I just wish they lasted longer.

author: Jessie Flori
title: Surprisingly good
content: This is actually my favorite pair of cheap airbuds I've ever owned. They're durable and amazing quality. I also love the look and feel.

author: Kevin H. Vendt
title: Well constructed, tinny sound.
content: These headphones, while a good value, are a little large for my ears, thus they hurt when I use them for any length of time. The sound is a little tiny as well. They seem to be well constructed and should last for awhile.

author: Keith Carter
title: Cable/wire is sturdy
content: These headphones sound very good to me, have used them most days and seem well constructed, i like the cable used, slick and sturdy. Bass could be a little more but it is good. At this price they are excellent for my usage.

author: Joey13lolive
title: Great product for the price
content: The construction of this product is very good is comparision to the all plastic and rubber ear buds in the market today.  I cannot speak specific to the difference in construction but feel the metal used adds to improved sound quality abd bass.

author: Stacey Smith
title: Love my new earbuds - high quality!
content: Arrived on time. Great product and works well.  Lives up to the reviews!  Update 8/1/2018 So good I bought a second pair!!!

author: Daniel Jenkins
title: Great earbuds
content: I have used these now for several weeks. I would compare the sound quality to the Bose earbuds that I own.

author: MyG*Black

content: Sound great but in the ears for an while they start making ear aches soar have to take due to metal the weight them or material dont want have them on for more then hr.

author: Jeff Alli
title: the bass is really good, and packaging is quality as we used to ...
content: This product is superb in quality, the bass is really good, and packaging is quality as we used to have. To solidify the point it comes with a pouch for easy storage, it is the best head phones I have had to date. Thank you to the sellers of this product.

author: Specialized1975
title: Incredible value! Best ear buds at this price and rival much more expensive ones.
content: These ear buds have great sound and come with a variety of ear pieces to fit your ears. All the controls work with my iPhone 6s and as good as my daughters Beats which cost much more. Safe the money and you are skimping on quality.

author: Tom
title: Good at first, garbage after a month
content: Head phones were great at first but now (one month of use) have a few issues. When ever I put on my coat while wearing these I hear a ton of static in the Head phones.  The microphone stopped working entirely, and when plugged in there is horrible feedback noises.

author: kdub1017
title: Yay!
content: These headphones are amazing! I have trouble finding earphones that will work with my ancient iPod so I was very pleased that these worked out. I listen to a lot of my music in bed and sometimes fall asleep listening to music. These are SO comfortable and cords don't tangle . Very happy with purchase.

author: MS
title: Durable, excellent product.
content: I purposely waited until I used the product for a significant period of time (now, about 3 months) before writing a review. I am very pleased with the durability and reliability of these earbuds/headphones. As far as sound quality over a wide range, I DO NOT have  a BOSE or similar pair of headphones to compare, but I feel that I lose nothing in terms of sound quality over a wide range of genres. The only negative that I can think of is that the wires sometimes become unwieldy, but I am not sure if there is a solution to that, as this problem occurs with all similarly wired earbuds.

author: GUTCH
title: I am very happy with these headphones and for the price they are very good
content: Good product great for the price. I tried using the microphone and not very good but enjoyed hearing music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great quality for a very reasonable price
content:
I really like these headphones. Good sound quality, especially for the price. Very nice bass! I use these for gaming, and people in my party say I have a very clear mic. Totally recommend this to others, cant tell you how long the life expectancy of these are though.

Update: my left headphone just cut out. 9/28/18. Still enjoy the product maybe I just got a faulty head set.

Unfortunately these is going back.

author: RT
title: My little buds.
content: Those are really nice and well made buds. I was pleasantly surprised testing it. Sound nice and clean, bass very good and deep. Comes with different sizes of cushions so you can use those which fits your ears . (In ears). I like those little cans very much. This is my opinion some other users may have different reviews. RW

Also, the shape of the ear buds are rather bulky-- the stem sticks out quite a bit... they don't lay flat against the ear.  Good luck if you happen to be wearing a hat over them.

author: Muun
title: Love em!
content: I loose headphone probably once a month and not having headphones is not an option as i use it a lot for work. Now, over time, this definitely makes a ding in my wallet - especially if I buy expensive ones. Fact is, I really do not want to jeopardize material and sound quality despite having because cheap on my investment in headphones. Here, I have the perfect product for me. I simply cannot believe this kind of quality is possible for a product at this price point. I feel like I won the lottery on this one. It is also good looking and I don't feel embarrassed using it. The product feels like it has been made with care and love and allows people on budget to really enjoy some good sound quality. The only issue, which probably is not much of an issue at all, is that the metal part touches my skin on my ear. When I first put it on, its suuuper cold. I am not a great fan of this sensation, but come on - for this price, for this quality? I have no right to complain...

author: Kat

author: Alexander Song
title: Long term review
content:
I generally like to wait a while before reviewing anything. I've had these headphones for almost a year and the experience has had its ups and downs.

At first, I was very happy with these headphones. The build quality was good and the sound was very good for the price range.

Eventually, some flaws in the design made me less happy. I do want to note that I use these headphones on a semi-daily basis and they still work great. I've had no issues with build or sound quality. But, if you walk a lot or exercise, these are not the headphones for you. They tend to fall out of my ear when moving around even when I tried the other ear sizes. I've had some issues with that in the past with other headphones but never as bad as this.

But the biggest issue is that the metal construction and the cylindrical design with sharp edges actually dig into my ear. I can position it so that it won't hurt me but that position also makes it more likely that they'll pop out. I can't wear these for any length of time unless I know I'm going to be motionless for the majority of the time. This is probably dependent on your ear shape but for me, these were NOT comfortable headphones.

Otherwise, the build and sound quality were admirable for the price.

author: Ricardo Wagner
title: Good value
content: Good build quality . Sound is good.. not much base and noise cancellation poor

author: LydiaK
title: I was very pleasantly surprised by the audio! If ...
content: I was very pleasantly surprised by the audio! If you're on a budget, you can't go wrong with these earphones. Only issue I've had is the provided earbud coverings don't fit my ears so I had to use some from an old set.

author: Ogsan1
title: Love these ear buds
content: Exceeded my expectations by leaping strides. Glad I got them. This company is the new standard in quality hands down. Glad I purchased, You will like them too.  Honest. The fit the sound are outstandidng

author: Joan
title: work great good sound
content: use these on my motorcycle and it kills outside noise well. good sound quality

author: Kindle Customer
title: I bought two different recommended ear buds and laid them out with earbuds that ...
content:
Incredible.....pay an extra couple of bucks and get these earphones.  I bought two different recommended ear buds and laid them out with earbuds that I was taking to the gym.  Tried them all to see which were the best and these jump out.  You will hear every note that the artist laid down in the original track.  I think that they are as good as my $100.00 Sony over the ear head phones.  Only thing better are my Bose and Sony noise canceling  headphones at $350.00.

You will not regret this purchase.  Plus....their packaging is over the top.  They have a great guarantee and the carry case they provide is perfect for bym bag, back pack or purse or shirt pocket.  I will probably buy another pair for me and maybe more for Christmas gifts.

author: Amazon Customer
title: TOP build quality and sound
content: Let me preface, I wasn't asked to write a review by the seller, I did this on my own within the first 5 minutes of using these. When I saw this product online, I was skeptical. I received the package and was ABSOLUTELY BLOWN AWAY! The packaging looks premium, opening it up shows the headphones, exactly as the photos show, in pristine condition with rubber bud covers for the headphone jack and the case. Excellent build and my roommates complimented the fabulous aesthetic. And the sound quality rivals my expensive over-ear headphones. I highly recommend!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Stop working properly after only a week.
content:
One earbud, the left to be exact, became muffled after just one week. Meaning it lasted only a mere 7 days before giving me that issue and so one side was clearly louder than the other.

They were also really uncomfortable to wear. It was a hassle because one side could fit perfectly in one ear but the other ear wouldn't fit nicely.

One of the replacement earbud tips was also ripped on arrival.

author: LeKendrick
title: Not worth it
content: As far as bass and noise cancelation go these are great headphones. But after about a month the right ear bud goes out. You have to keep hitting it to get it to come back for maybe 10 minutes. I've had to order these twice because of this and the second pair has now done the same thing. Can't deal with it. Not worth buying in my opinion

author: MAI-TRAM NGUYEN
title: Comfortable ear buds with good sound
content: For the price, this earbud set is comfortable, and the sound is good. I primarily use this for my iPhone/MacBook for meetings and to listen to videos.

author: J
title: Great headphones but...
content: These inexpensive headphones sound great. To listen to it on an iPhone with no sound jack (only a lightening connection), you have to purchase an adapter. This renders the controls useless. It does not matter to me all that much. Also, the only way to tell the L from R bud is by the controls. The controls are attached to the right bud. Otherwise, these are great headphones.

author: freehold
title: The Y
content: I Love it. Thanks

author: K. r.
title: A set of pricey quality headsets for a steal of a deal
content: Pretty sweet set of headphones for 14 bucks. Bass is solid, not overwhelming. Perfect for phone calls and rock music/jazz which is my jam. If you want super deep bass or dubstep-worthy headphones, you will need to spend more than 20 bucks!! The case these headphones came in even looked niced, much nicer than some 20 something dollar headphones you find at the local electronic stores. Totally worth it.

author: Ben
title: Great sound, terrible durability.
content: These headphones were great right out of the box.  I loved the way they sounded and the decibel level they were able to put out.  That lasted for about a week.  Maybe I got a bunk pair, but these things were treated like royalty and they are dead.  They started showing signs of wear about 4 or 5 days in when they would make my phone bug out when I would increase the volume.  Then I was listening to a YouTube video on my computer, totally stationary, and I literally listened to the left bud go out.  If Beltron is willing to send me another pair, I would say the buy is worth it.  If not, I wouldn't buy from them again.  Wish they lasted longer, because I was in love with them when they showed up.

author: K. Thornton
title: Good earbuds
content: Too big for ear and does not cancel noise very well

author: ok
title: It broke again!
content:
My son loves it,  but after a couple of weeks one side stop working,  order another one,  will see if I have more luck next time.
Edit: So they sent me a new pair but after 2 or 3 months the microphone buttons started to act up and start pressing for no reason and then after 2 days it broke completely but the sound from the earbuds still work it works on and off sometimes it works then later nothing. That's why I will update my review to two stars.
The bag is good but it keeps on breaking and the metal pokes out every time I try to open it.

author: Sydney Jacobs
title: Best earbuds I’ve used
content: My favorite earbuds. They last a long time. These are sturdy. The sound quality is great.

author: S. Katz
title: So Good I Bought a Second Set
content:
I purchased one of these a few months ago and have been very satisfied so I bought a second.  I'm writing this review based on the original unit the the new one as they are the same.
The sound quality is as good as any earphone I have owned.  The battery lasts about eight hours and recharges is about two.  I bought the second so I could charge one while using the other.
Controls are easy to operate and the phone reports battery level.
All in all a lot of headphone for not much money.

author: Lisa Suzette Henson
title: Buy quality. Mine stopped working.
content: Loved these but they stopped working shortly after purchasing. I wasted my money.

author: Jocelyn Hsu
title: Very sleek, nice quality
content: These earphones were very nice quality, and they look fantastic. They do not feel flimsy, but actually quite weighty. The packaging was sleek and it also came with its own pouch!

author: Nikole Davis
title: Not very Comfortable
content: These are not comfortable and keep falling out of my ears.  When attempting to use to talk to someone, I ended up having to take them out and just use the device through my car speaker or use the phone the old fashioned way.

author: Lana
title: Nice
content: Gave these as a gift. Only the black ear cushions were usable. The others fell out too easily. Sound quality is great and so is the look.

author: Linda O.
title: Falls out of my ears - won't stay in
content: The earbuds will not stay in my ears and I have tried all of the ear tips that came with it. Finally went with the memory foam as they are a little more "sticky" and flexible, but still not a good fit for me. Since they won't fit in my ear deep enough, any quality of bass is totally lost, as is any sound quality so I couldn't give them a better rating. I purchased these to use with an iPod and an Android phone and they replaced Sony earbuds which lasted for years before one of the buds came apart. I do like that the volume can easily be turned up on the controls on the cord as well as the pause feature, neither of which my Sony earbuds had, but the constant falling out of my ears is just annoying.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Low Quality and Low Durability
content: Out of the box the sound quality and peak volume was about as good as the free headphones you get on a plane. Which is to say not good at all. That doesn't really matter to me though because I primarily needed them to listen to podcasts. The big problem is really that they started to not function properly within a few weeks. At first one ear wasn't as loud as the other. After a few more weeks the volume started to change up and down kind of randomly. And I had wasn't rough on them either. They only ever sat on my desk at work and were never crumpled into a pocket or slammed into crushed or sat on. Also, when I made calls no one could seam to hear me through the headphone microphone. Find another set of headphones.

author: Adam M.
title: lasted a couple months
content: Well they were nice while they lasted. If they were a bit more durable they would be a steal. but they broke a few months in, so I tossed em. not worth the RMA hassle

author: mostlyHarmy
title: Broken audio jack one month in
content: These were fine for a basic set of earbuds but a momt in and the jack bent. I was afraid the end would get stuck in my phone jack but I manged to get it out. I keep my phone in my back pocket a lot and have owned many sets of headphones but this is the first time that has ever happened.

author: creep twee
title: They keep falling out.
content:
All of the features that the company advertises are pretty true to these earbuds.
PROS:
- they look amazing
- very well packaged
- sound range is loud
- bass is very prominent (didn’t change any equalizer settings on my devices, just the basics)
- the microphone works
———
- First CON with these: the buds are on the heavy side and seem to FALL out with the slightest movements. I’ve tried (over and over again) to really bury them into my ears, along with trying the included different sized silicone bits. They still end up falling out.
- Second CON: the earbuds tend to get WARM after about 15 minutes of use and that’s without the volume being turned way up. (About 3 ticks on an iPhone)
- CON #3: you can hear when the wires of these are tapped or touch anything solid
———
Not recommended for running, at all. When I use these, I generally find myself having to sit still, constantly wiggle them back into my ears.

author: Ryan
title: Great Quality, Affordable Price & Smooth-Fit Design
content:
I've purchased over 7 of these so far. Here is what I've found;

Pros:

High Quality
Affordable
Great design
Has Mic

Cons:

Not good for working out at a gym. Constantly falls out of ear at Gym.

Note: This only pertains to the Gym, these have no issues with falling out of your ears while doing non-vigorous activities such as riding in a car, at school, walking, biking, etc.

I would 100% recommend these to anyone who appreciates high quality music, good bass, ability to make calls with the headphones microphone, smooth-fit design.

I consider these to be equivalent to those $150 Dr. Dre beats headphones. I've had both these and Dr Dre and these are identical in quality and only a fraction of the price.

Thank you Betron for giving an amazing pair of headphones.

author: Luigui 007
title: Great pair of earbuds
content: For the most part I enjoy this product. It has a metal body on the earbuds and a sturdy material for the wires and good bass. My main concern is the audio quality though because it sounds a bit muffled. I have purchased a pair before and it sounded wayyy more clear but this pair seems to be a tad muffled(probably got a bad one from the batch) but all in all it's a great product for sure! Very durable.

author: Bolt ENG
title: Good Sounds, Cheaply Made.
content:
So far so good.  I received these headphones today.  They came in a nice package which included the extra rubber tips, as well as a pair of foam ones.  I think the tips tend to run larger than normal (I have used the medium sized tips that have come with headphones I have previously bought, but needed the small ones that came with these headphones).  The tips still don't feel like they fit quite right, but that could be because the headphones stick out of the ear quite a bit.  They do not seem to fall out, regardless.

The sound quality is actually pretty good, though I am no expert.  I can clearly hear a wide range (I played a diversity of songs and compared the sound with some Sennheiser HD 598 Cs close-backed headphones), with decent balance throughout the range that I can tell.  The sound obviously is not as nice as with the Sennheiser, as these headphones are not as noise-isolating, but I would say they are really good for being so cheap.

In terms of build quality, these are made of cheap construction.  That should be expected with such cheap headphones.  The plastic components (all the gold looking parts that are not the actual metal jack are made of some cheap plastic.  The speaker casings are also made of cheap-feeling plastic.  The cord seems to be decent, however, it is lacking much bend protection at the joints.  The plastic piece that slides up and down the cords that go to the individual speakers seems pretty loose, but appears to do an adequate job.

The microphone seems to work fine, and the controls are adequate for a Samsung Galaxy S8 (No fast-forward or rewind, but it still has volume, play/pause, call control, play next track, and play previous track).

I hope this helps.  Will update on durability if parts begin to fail.

author: Russ Mc
title: These are likely to be a clever counterfeit knockoff to genuine Betron buds sold in the UK.
content:
These are a $20 joke, don't waste your money. And pay close attention to the ad; This seller is a Chinese shop posing as the real Betron dealer!! I should have read the description carefully, then I would have seen the 'Chinglish' grammatical errors. Don't buy these from this particular guy, it's not Betron. These are a very very clever knockoff, but not quite good enough.

These earbuds are nothing more than $3 drivers crammed into a cheesy gold plated case that feels like low-grade cast tin with a lousy ugly gold coating that immediately rubs away. The build quality is utter garbage. The bass is OKish. Mids and highs sound like wank through a tin can, just plain unacceptable. I have a set that came with my Roku that blows these away.

Cheesy Chinese bling.. don't waste your time or money. They're about on par with $8 gas station earbuds.

Maybe I have a really clever knockoff. But after seeing the design in person, I don't want the real thing either. What a huge letdown this was.

Now that I think about it, these definitely have to be counterfeit. All the logos are correct, but this box looks nothing like the box genuine UK Betron YSM1000's come in. And only 3 sets of mediocre ear pieces. Wich the the REAL Betron website shows is completely different to what's being sold here in the US under this Chinese rat shack Amazon shop. BEWARE

author: Rachel Roque
title: Ugh I hate these
content: You have to really jam these earbuds into your ears, and there is a very fine point between where they are too far out and sound weak, and where they are too far in and sound muffled. Also, the cord constantly catches on things and yanks them out partially or entirely - it just seems like they are made for ears that are differently sized than mine? Is that a thing? Additionally, the speaker sucks and has to be held to your mouth if you are trying to use them on your phone. I just really don't understand the good reviews.

author: Eddie Brown
title: Super hyped to super disappointed!
content: When I first got these and heard the quality of the sounds, I was blown away! After purchasing previous sets and having them (2 set package) fail me a little after 30 days, I thought "wow I hope these last!" Well, they didn't.  Not even 30 days. The right side dropped volume so low you could barely hear it. Then, a couple of hours later, it started working again. But I knew in my heart that this is only temporary, and I was right. The right side stopped working altogether.  What a disappointment. The search continues.

author: Eric Richter
title: ... has had 2 pairs of Beats earphones that are super expensive said that these are even better than Beats
content: My son has had 2 pairs of Beats earphones that are super expensive said that these are even better than Beats! His Beats didn't even last long so he is extremely happy with the super output and crisp sound he gets from Betron. The price is what really shocked him. Well, my hubby was so impressed with them so I ordered another Betron set for him too. Sometimes a brand is just a brand (Beats) and is not worth the money you pay for.

author: DRock
title: Best Bang for your buck
content:
These Headphones are AWESOME! They sound great while listening to multiple different forms of sounds.

I listen to tons of Podcasts, Rock, Musicals, and even meetings at work on this headphones, and all of them sound great! Not to mention the price is UNDER $20! Did I mention that they look great too? I cannot suggest these headphones enough.

author: P.
title: Un-BEAT-able!
content: These earbuds are the best that I have ever had.  There are extremely durable.  Fit very snuggly in my ears.  The sound quality is simply amazing for the price.  And, the mic is ferocious!  I will buy again!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Defective product
content: We bought these January 8 and today the left ear bud stopped working. We see that it’s covered by a 1 year warranty please advise

author: Jon McVey
title: More bass then you would think possible.
content: Was looking for something cheap but of acceptable quality to replace my ancient falling apart Iphone 4 earbuds from years back. I happened to get these 75% off for $10.00. After hearing the sound quality, I would have gladly paid $40 for these headphones. Absolutely incredible sound quality, blocks out all noise and almost has too much bass as if that were possible. Very slick design and feel as well. 10/10 would recommend to anybody, on sale or otherwise.

author: Steven L.
title: Meh.
content: Sound quality is comparable to the earbuds I bought from Walmart for $4.88.  I've had these for less than two weeks, so it's hard to judge how durable they really are.

author: Chris69
title: solid built
content: they are made of metal and sound fantastic best price I have seen

author: William D. Clifford Jr
title: I would definitely recommend these!
content: I love this product so much that I bought a second pair after I misplaced the first! However 3 weeks after I got the 2nd pair the right headphones volume decreased. I had the 1st pair for 3 months and it never happened to that one so the 2nd pair could have just been a faulty one. But I would definitely recommend this pair of headphones.

author: Kama
title: Ear buds kept popping out
content: At first glance, the product looked awesome!  But I had a hard time keeping the buds in my ear canal.  They kept popping out and falling off, so that was annoying.  I gave up after a week and plan on purchasing another pair with a different shape.  I would caution others to purchase a pair of ear buds that fit your ears comfortably and without issues.  At least now I know that this shape does not work for me probably because my ear canal is too small.

author: mfpatterson
title: Controls for iPhone non existent.
content: I’d give these a better review if they actually did everything they are supposed to do. Sound is good, fit good but the controls don’t work. Can’t utilize the controls at all on my iPhone 7+. I’m using them all day at work and having to utilize my phones controls kinda defeats the purpose. To pack it all back up to return Is not worth the time and effort due to the cost of these headphones.

author: Thomas Sutphin
title: Amazing!!!
content: These headphones are absolutely fantastic and for the price a steal!  Very bassy, excellent sound quality!  Forgot those audiophiles, they don't know what they are talking about.  Bought these on a whim and was incredibly surprised!

author: Amy Sanchez
title: Great
content: They fall out pretty easily but they're aesthetically pleasing and sound is fantastic

author: Ronda Klassen
title: one ear stopped working
content: These ear buds have really good quality of sound.  They are a little big and hurt my ears after hours of use but overall pretty happy until now.  Now one ear isn't working at all so not sure they were worth it.

author: Francisco Fernandez
title: Great product, but arrived NOT as advertised
content:
I had ordered these Betron headphones/earbuds several years ago, and I was very satisfied with the sound quality and and performance of this product. The product itself, for the most part, is fine. Unfortunately, it is not exactly as advertised in the pictures offered.

Firstly, the package it came in was not the one shown in the pictures. It was a small square box that did not include ALL of the items that were shown in the pictures showcasing the product (see pictures uploaded). Secondly, I noticed that the headphones did not have the name brand display as shown in the product pictures. When I first bought these came in the box as advertised, with EVERYTHING shown in the seller's pictures.

author: Andrea Markov
title: incredible quality for the price
content: these headphones are light years above the quality of others at this price point - highly recommend - love the flexible cords and the snug fitting ear buds (most fall out on me) and the sound quality is really good.

author: Natalie B
title: Good: I like the remote with volume control
content:
Good:  I like the remote with volume control.
Bad: Noise isolation was poor no matter which size tips I tried.  Large metal casings are heavy and uncomfortable.  Right side sound stopped working after one week.

I'm going back to cheap plastic earbuds.  They are more comfortable and much longer lasting.

author: Camille Hunt
title: Well Made Headphones
content: I'm not sure that I needed such heavy-duty headphones but I am happy I ordered them.

author: Carolyn E Ferreira
title: Heavy, fall out easily, small ears
content: They are really heavy and long so they can fall out of your ears easily.  The portion that is sticking out is longer than the portion inside your ear, so they are off-balance and can tip out of your ear.  So they are only good if you are sitting still in a quiet place.  If you are moving around, they will fall out.  Also, they do not stay in well in general, so they are not noise cancelling on a plane, which is the main time I use them.  I often have to hold them up so that they are aligned with my ear canal and have better sound.  Would not buy again.

author: Sinclair Trengrove
title: A must get!
content: Betron are one of the best earphone producers. Surpassing Apple by a long shot. A cheaper price for better quality. Noise cancellation, with big gummy size, is similar to wearing earplugs. The bass is much greater than all earphones below 20$, even greater than Apple earphones. The sound quality is just amazing. They last a long time. I bought these twice since I sadly lost the first pair. Beautiful metallic design. A nice weight to them. Comes with several gummy sizes. One of which is the exact material of earplugs. Comes with a nice baggy to store the earphones. Betron, keep on improving to get a larger audience!

author: Tascha P
title: Almost too good....
content:
I have had to edit my review because I have inadvertently tried to murder my head phoned in almost every way possible and they refuse to die or lose quality. I have accidentally run them through the washer and dryer, dropped one earbud in a cup of coffee, ran them over with my office chair, etc.

The sound remains fantastic, bass still great, mic works like a champ. They look great. Only slight negative is that they are a little heavy. But I would recommend these to anyone and will be purchasing a ton for Christmas this year

author: Mary Locke
title: love love love these little headphones!!!!!!!
content: love love love these little headphones!!!!!!! they are tiny but the sound is huge. my ears are small so I removed the plastic coverings but thats just me. great headphones

author: Mike Baron
title: Really nice earbuds
content:
Came with foam ear pads that really help seal them in. Bass is really good. About 20% louder than some cheaper earbuds I just bought to replace my old ones.
The GOOD:
+ Sound is really good. Good Bass and loud.
+ Foam earpads are a plug
+ Tangle free wires? Yup...my first pair of tangle free wires and they actually don't get tangled. Imagine that.
+ Comes with a nice carrying case, very slim. I actually use this one.
+ Mic and controls work great.
+ Construction definitely better than any cheapy earbuds. The wires are a bit thicker in clear housing.
+ And did I mention....they sound really great.

The Bad:
- Took me a couple days to figure out which one was Left and Right. On their website, they show a picture of a pair with Gold colored bases on the wiring marked L and R. That's where this one is, but the base is black color, so missed it the first couple of days. No biggie, just a bit strange to mark anything in black plastic.
- Kinda "blingy" with gold, silver and shiny cords. Probably really nice if you like that, and any other options may drive cost up, but something to note if you are not into "blingy" stuff.

author: Lisa M Hanna
title: Probably not best for the gym.
content: These work out well for office use. If I were out jogging or working out...maybe not so much. The sound could be better. Sometimes I can hear the cord rubbing against me as I move but again, I'm in an office. Also, at first, they hurt my ears a bit. The metal casing is sharp and rubs against my ears. I cant comment on durability yet. Its fine for me tho.

author: DJ JIN
title: wires are pretty malleable but not open to tear
content: Solid bass, wires are pretty malleable but not open to tear. Often go running with these headphones without any reduction in sound quality or any increase in wire tangling. Sometimes the mic does not pick up sound but it's not frequent enough to be annoying.

author: Diana
title: Works Perfectly for PS4
content: I purchased these for my husband and I to use exclusively with PS4 Dualshock controllers. They work perfectly. You can see in the picture he rolled up the left earbud and just twist-tied it so it's not dangling while we use just one side. The mic is on the right earbud line, but they're bullet shaped so you could pop it in your other ear if you prefer. The cable is covered in a very soft, flexible silicone-feeling insulation. It's got a little weight to it so it hangs nicely but doesn't tangle easily. It also comes with a little plastic clip you could hook to your shirt, four sizes of silicone earbud cushions, and a nice carry pouch with a pinch-open top. I have very small ears and don't usually like this style of earbud, but the smallest cushion size (while a little tough to get on the earbud itself) fits my ears comfortably enough. I haven't worn them long enough to tell whether I'll be comfortable wearing them for an hour+ of gaming. My husband can wear most any style of earbuds and says these have been comfortable for him for hours of gaming wear. We're both very happy to have found such durable, nice looking earbuds that work for the PS4 without shelling out a lot of money or settling for annoying, sweaty, over-the-ear gaming headsets.

author: Robin
title: Highs are garbage
content: The highs on these headphones are garbage. What is good bass without highs to balance?

author: Bao Ngoc Thi Phan
title: Great Sound Quality
content: Great sound quality; when they are pushed snugly in my ears, I hardly hear the surrounding noise even with my laptop's volume set as low as 6. I am basic when it comes to technology devices so I feel they fit my needs. They fulfill their product descriptions.

author: Marua
title: One side stopped working already
content: After about 4 months of use, one side of the earbuds stopped working (actually very very faint so it is almost inaudible).

author: OldCat
title: Great Sound at a Great Price
content: I am buying these two Beltron YSM1000 for gifts because I bought my Beltron YSM1000 about a month ago and have been enjoying its clarity from top to bottom on my MP3 for my daily walks. A bit strident and not quite as detailed for serious listening under more quiet conditions when compared to my Klipsch S4's, but the Beltron is still an excellent headphone at about 1/5 the price. And they seem to be well made enough to withstand some wear and tear without falling apart.

author: ANDRE L. DE GRAAF
title: Great sound
content: Very nice ear buds. Sounds great. Bought the BS10s a short time ago that I am also very happy with. But as I said in that review I prefer a symmetrical design like the YSM1000s.

author: Worship Leader
title: Quality and longevity
content: At first sounded good, but then began to pull apart after only 3 uses leading worship at church.  Saw mixed reviews and thought I'd give them a shot for the price, but I was wrong.  I asked other worship leaders what they had, then I spent $10 more with another brand and got a much better quality product.

author: Grace Black
title: Great Sound
content: The earphones are great quality. They hurt my ears a little at first but then I switched the earpiece covers and it fixed the problem. The only thing is that something poked through my carry case at the top and I wasn’t really able to use it anymore which sucked ‘cause it was great to help me keep track of and store my earphones. Would it be possible to just get a new carry case?

author: Hamid Noorian
title: Betron YSM1000 Headphones, Earbuds, High Definition, in-Ear, Noise Isolating, Heavy Deep Bass
content: Great sound, does not stay in my ear.  I tried all the different ear adapters, none of them work for me.  I will keep it since it sounds good.

author: PNWShawn
title: Very good for the money! Comfortable and good sound quality.
content: I bought these to replace an aging pair of JVC “marshmallow-type” in-ear earphones. The standard ear buds that came with my iPhone are okay - nothing spectacular - but not very comfortable and don’t stay in my ears very well. My old JVCs were good for filtering out the outside world, but the ear cushions eventually get hard and I wanted something with better quality. These Betron YSM 1000 earbuds are awesome! Very comfortable and sound quality is very good for small, in-ear buds. Not exactly studio monitors, but for inexpensive, compact phones they are excellent. Base response is surprisingly good, and they stay in my ears without falling out. For the money these are an excellent buy! Highly recommended. Serious audiophiles will need to shell out a lot more money as these aren’t going to satisfy true hifi enthusiasts, but then again they probably aren’t shopping for in-ear phones anyway. For the average consumer who wants to make phone calls and listen to streaming music on their phone or iPod or watch streaming video, these are an excellent choice. They work great with my iPhone and iPad. The remote works as expected to answer calls, adjust volume, and pause videoI don’t think I could find anything better in this price range, or even at twice the price. I’m very happy with my purchase.

author: Tony Lopez
title: First 30 minutes
content: These earphones are awesome. The sound is clear and has unexpected bass behind it. The product feels sturdy with a rubber coating over the wires and a gold aux output. For 10$ I would recommend these headphones to anyone tired of using volume control manually on their phone.

author: Raj
title: LOVE IT!
content: FINALLY, affordable earbud headphones they look and sound great, and have a quality build that won’t break after just a few months!

author: SongBird
title: They don't fit my ears
content: Really nice packaging and materials. However they were too big to fit in my ears well enough to stay in, even with the smallest cover thingies. author: Aly Boughton

content: Headphones that sound great, better than most beats or expensive Bluetooth ones. After a few months with them it's very clear that they aren't made to last. author: john langenbach

author: Taylor G LeClair

author: Amazon Customer
title: Break easily and bad sound
content: I've had them for about 3 months now and they've already broken. I tend to be very gentle and careful with headphones especially after my last pair broke, but somehow while I was sitting down listening to music, the earphone for left ear stopped working. The sound just stopped out of nowhere and won't come back. Also the piece that connects the actual earbud to the cord keeps slipping off of the right earphone. Other than poor durability, these earphones don't offer the best sound. I like earphones with crisp and clear sound and a deep bass. The bass is great but in my opinion, the sound is somewhat muffled and drowned out. However they do get really loud. The sound quality isn't really an issue when u switch out the standard earbuds covers for the foam noise isolating ones. But they break very easily, are impossible to clean, and don't stay in your ear. These earphones are also quite bulky. The little bag they include to store your earbuds in is a nice touch (same quality as comes with Beats earbuds) and keeps them from getting tangled. Only complaint is that the parts that go into your ear don't tend to stay so well if you're working out or moving around a lot. title: for a average earphone user these will sound phenomenal!
content:
When I bought these earphones I got them for a discount at 13.99$ which is a great buy for the quality and sound. Of course the material and durability quality is just a tad bit lower (the transparent wiring is not of the highest quality, there are some hard plastic coverings on certain areas, and to my disappointment the earbuds are low quality which detracts from the overall above average quality ) than those crazy expensive earphones but it will last you for enough time. If you are a professional musician you will definitely notice that the bass tries to drown out some lack of crisp music clarity and that the sound quality is a bit on the non clear side. But to an average person wearing earphones these will sound just like beats and any other top notch brands. I have seen a few people comment about using these to workout, I have used these to go running for 3+ miles on treadmill and outside and they are just like my apple earphones. They will occasionally slip out and you have to push them back in but they work fine for me during running.

its also important to note that if you watch youtube reviews of these earphones the box and stuff is not the same as what is offered here on amazon. I believe the youtubers got a reviewer box or some higher end packaging.

author: Naya
title: Betron is a Fantastic Company
content:
Idk if I ever left Betron feedback specifically but it's too late now if I haven't so I thought I'd write this review instead.

Betron is a fantastic company and I highly recommend their earbuds. First off, I've never tried out $50+ earbuds and don't know if they'd last any longer than a cheap pair. But I stick to $8-25 earbuds because every time, in a year and a half or less, is when earbuds start dying on me. More often than not the sound starts going out of one ear far sooner than a year even. Plus, most earbuds for that price range don't have the high quality sound that this pair from Betron does.

Not only that, but 8.5 months after I bought my first pair, when the sound finally started shorting out in one ear, I contacted Betron and politely told them about my issue. They no questions asked, an hour or so later responded apologizing for the earbuds not meeting their usual high standards and sent me a replacement pair for absolutely free. My new pair just showed up today about a week or so later.

Oh and one more thing, it looks like Betron is working on improving the earbuds. The button switch design is different on my replacement pair but they have the same model number. I highly recommend Betron's earbuds. They don't have the subpar sound quality of other $20 or less earbuds and the company is very nice.

author: Kev
title: More than expected
content:
These headphones perform better than the ones my phone (LG G6) came with, I am at a loss to explain that.  On top of that, the microphone seems slightly better than the phone's build-in microphone, according to people I call often. The sound is quite crisp, compared to the many other inexpensive headsets I've worn out.  More informed reviewers than me state it has "great bass response", I think that is correct.

It has a number of music-player functions that vary from obvious (volume, next track, pause, etc) to Morse-code ("Press the center button three times quickly and hold" to rewind current tune). I imagine if you need that don't-touch-the-phone functionality, well, there it is.

I usually don't mention packaging as it is not relevant to performance, but they do toss in extra pairs of ear-canal-bud-adapter thingies and an unusual pouch to store the headset in.  The foam-lined magnet-latched box is grade-A, don't see how that helps to sell online.

I do have two nits to pick with these headphones, but these are sort of begrudging compliments:  (1) The ear-buds are unusually heavy, so you might have to swap the ear-canal-thingies and/or not do aerobics or kick-boxing with these. Jogging or treadmill might be a real problem.  (2) Your mileage might vary, but my wife liked the sound/microphone so much that, uh, I needed to buy a second set.  Which I did and it performs as good as the first sample :^D

author: Wojciech Wolinski
title: Comfortably, good-looking earbuds with excellent sound, good value.
content: Best earbuds I ever purchased at this price point and possibly the best earbuds I ever owned. Excellent sound quality. Clear highs, nice mids, bass is surprisingly good as well. Music sounds excellent as does spoken work like audio books, etc. All three ranges are equally distributed. I wouldn't add or subtract from any of the three. They feel solidly build and the chord looks like it will not tangle easily. The gold colored volume control/mic piece is place on the left side which makes reaching for it feel natural with my right hand. Most earbuds have the controller on right side and that makes for awkward reaching. They fit very nicely in the ears and are very comfortable. I think they will be good for work even for wearing them all day without discomfort. They look cool too. I really like the fact that the red ear bud has a red ring around it and the left has a black ring. This will make it easy to know which is left/right. They also have L and R on the earbuds. Overall a great buy. I highly recommend this product.

content: Let's start with everybody's taste is different. My source music is often from analog tape to CD (AAD format) so the quality and sound will be much different than more modern music from recent years. So having said that, I believe the bass is much more Dynamic and clear than similar priced headphones. Highs and mid-range sound good too even though the style of music I listen to can often reveal the tape Source sound. These headphones do not reveal as much of the tape source as others. Comes with the standard interchangeable earbuds for different size ears and a small carrying pouch. Standard  volume buttons, track selection, pause, mute, microphone so no new innovations or surprises. So overall I'm very satisfied with these headphones. The cons are the wire seems rather flimsy and delicate and I can only imagine that they are going to pull out of the plug in the headphone piece itself. This hasn't happened yet it just seems flimsier than other headphones. I'm a bit hard on headphones and the wire usually breaks for me around the 3.5 mm Jack and I have a hard time getting headphones to last for a month to a year. Wireless, which these are not, break on me even faster so I don't wish to invest a lot of money in headphones. author: Amazon Customer
title: Good if you just like bass. Not so great for everything else.
content:
I've spent an entire day with these so I'll give a review.

I'm really conflicted here. On one hand, the bass sounds really good, like high-quality expensive good. But when it comes to actual vocals and certain instruments, the quality weakens. Vocals sound muffled, distant and cheap. Instruments like the piano sound painful. It sounds like a cheap pair of earbuds with top quality bass - which feels weird because some songs will sound amazing and some will sound pretty bad. The bass also really feels like it overpowers the vocals. You'll find yourself wanting to louder the volume in more lyrical based songs, but that also loaders the bass - so it really conflicts with each-other.

Aesthetically the earbuds are really nice. They look and feel really expensive. But for some reason, they hurt my ears after a while. I've never had this problem before with any other pair of earphones. They're actually pretty heavy earbuds - so maybe it's that, or maybe the strong bass just gets to my ears after an hour or so.

I used to have a $5 pair of earbuds that I loved. I purchased them for years, and the company that made them went out of business. I decided to try these, based on the reviews - but they don't live up to the hype. I see some of the top comments saying "as good as Beats!" and stuff, but there's just no way.

I wouldn't say they're horrible, but they're just not for me. I'm probably going to return them and look for something else.

I need noise blocking earbuds because i listen to white noise at night to block out my noisy neighbors, seeing as I live in a college dorm and college kids are always loud. Turns out that these buds sometimes randomly SHOCK my ear and jolt me awake. The sound pops as well. There are times when the fear of being electrocuted kept me up and even, ironically, prevented me from sleeping.

So I went onto Amazon right now and looked at all the 1 star reviews, and a substantial number of them included how the earbuds do, in fact, electro shock you, which confirmed that this isnt something that happened because of mistreatment to the earbuds, and that this is a manufactering problem for the product period.

author: RobandAlishaP
title: Great Budget Headphones For Under 20$
content:
Edit: I was originally going to give these earbuds a one star review, the right earbud wasn't working when they were delivered. I sent and email to Betron about my problem. Within a week a new pair was sent to me for free. I was astonished at the customer service. Here is my updated review.

These earbuds are an excellent choice at their price point. For $20 or Under these headphones have a lot of pros and very minor problems which is stated below.
First, the contents of the box. The box Includes 4 pairs of ear tips. Large, Medium, Small, and Memory Foam Type. The selection of ear tips included makes sure that no ear size is left behind. I favored the foam tips because they provided great sound isolation, snug fit, and overall great sound. The box also includes a carrying pouch and a wire clip. For just under $20 these earbuds come with a lot of different options for the user. Now, let's get into the pro's and the con's.

The Pro's:
Great Sound Isolation
Great Ear tip Selection
Deep and Powerful Bass
Handy Carrying Case
Stylish Look
Snug Fit and Comfortable

The Con's:
When Listening Too Classical Music, the Lows Can Slightly Overpower The Mids And Highs, But This Is Almost Not Noticeable.
The Memory Foam Ear tips Can Tear, So Be Gentle With Them.

In Conclusion, if you are looking for an affordable, great sounding, and comfortable pair of earbuds, I would totally recommend these. The Sound, Comfort, And Style make the Betron YSM1000s a great choice for just under $20.

title: BEWARE - painful to wear, failing within less than a day of use.
content:

As far as I know I have a normal outer ear, never had any problem with ear buds before.

I was planning to sand down the sharp edges and work with getting a better fit to my ear - however within 3 hours of use the left speaker started to crackle and hiss at a high decibel in my ear. I plugged them into a variety of sources and all the same.

Bottom line, these are poor quality, painful ear buds that I regret buying.

Whenever my phone shifts in my pocket and the headphones are plugged in, it makes a static like popping sound right in my ear, and the volume changes on its own. Usually the volume goes down, which is better than up since that could damage my hearing, but it is still extremely annoying and not worth it.

I should note that this is not just a problem with my specific pair. After discovering this problem, I returned the headphones and they sent me another pair. These ones had the same problem. Ultimately I will have to return them, get my money back, and find a different brand to buy.

author: D. Lamb
title: So far, excellent.  Works with Kyocera Phones just fine with an adapter.
content: I used these with my Kyocera android flip phone.  Perfect sound quality. Great performance.  These are vey well-constructed.  So far, so good. The cord is tangle-free, which is great.  I have a whole drawer full of poor-quality ones, some of which cost as much or more.  It was a shot in the dark when I bought them because not all headphones work with the adapters or even the phone. There should be a listing of which phones these work with. I notice most headphones list IOS or Android, but that does not tell the customer which brands it fits.

author: Bibek
title: Waste of money.
content:
Sound quality is good at this price point. But the earbuds doesn't hold on ears, they silps and fallout from ear, I need to hold with hand. I tried replaceing with all extra earbuds but all are same. Earbuds plactic was so cheap quality so it doesn't hold on ear.
I feel waste of money.

author: bone
title: great 'phones for a great price!
content: Have just received these, but my initial response is WOW! They are comfortable, and do 'all the things' as described.

author: Mia
title: Great sound pick up and clear microphone
content:
These in earphones are very comfortable for me. The microphone is just what I hoped it would be since the people I call say it sounds super clear.
The seller was very prompt and The earphones arrived in two days in perfect condition.  The pouch provided for the earphones is very useable to protect the earphones when I need to carry them along. I’m very happy with this product!

author: Jack_bought_this
title: Awesome sound with iPhone!
content:
These are easily the best earbuds I've ever owned. Out of the box they sounds GREAT with IOS and for earbuds the bass sounds amazing. The button on neck are easy to push small and the casing around them is tough so they will likely never get damaged.

The only thing I wanted to note for potential buyers is that the cable is thin and lightweight which I really like you can barely even tell you're wearing earbuds. The only thing is they seem like they could be damaged easily so these are not for heavy working conditions or accident prone people unless you don't mind risking it.

That said I just got them and they are already the best earbuds I've ever own. Even came with lil memory form earbuds for people with oddly shaped inner ears.

author: Jacob
title: The best pair of ear buds I've owned.
content: They're a little bulky than the average ear bud buy they're amazing. The bass is incredible. If you use ear buds and lay on your side in a bed or something they will definitely poke into your ear because they stick out quite a bit.

author: M.E.G.
title: Great Headphnes
content: They play with clear quality and sound. I also like that they come with a carrying pouch. I would definitely purchase them again.

author: MICHAEL ABREU
title: The best aesthetically pleasing ear buds
content: These headphones are definitely something different,They feel very high quality and they come in this very nice pouch.My only problem is the material used for the wires,It’s like a translucent soft plastic.The headphones do sound impressive and bass heavy.I would recommend those who look for high quality headphones and bass heavy

author: KissedByFire
title: Quality consistency for people with bad pets
content: I bought 4 pairs of these because my dog somehow keeps finding them and eating them. The first pair he ate, the earpiece broke apart but I still had good sound so they were usable until the 2 extra pairs came. He just ate another pair and the sound is slightly out on one side from damage but still good enough to wait for my 4th pair! My dog gets ☆ one star for his behavior, but I give these ☆☆☆☆☆ five stars for quality consistency

author: Loren
title: DEPENDABLE!
content: I'm impressed! The sound quality and bass are better than most standard headphones but they're nothing to boast about. There is only a slight improvement in noise cancellation compared to standard headphones if any. I'm very harsh when it comes to taking care of headphones and over the past month these headphones have taken a beating. The mic works fine even after droping them several times. Im very pleased with the durability but I think the bass could be better

author: David L.
title: Good sound, good comfort, good value
content: These appear to be good quality.  I did not rate noise cancellation because they do not have active noise-cancelling electronics, but the in-ear-canal design does reduce noise, much like good earplugs would.  With all the talk about bass, I was concerned that it might be too strong, but that was not the case; the bass is enjoyable. I find that the in-canal design is more comfortable over a longer period of use than the earbud design.

author: Blessed
title: Sounds is of good quality
content: I really like the design as well as the sound. Really nice quality for the price!

author: ZuluNiner
title: Clear headphone with great sound quality
content: First and foremost microphone feature is great along with the sound cancel.  Quality cord, plugs.  Base was not as good but overall excellent headphone.

author: Alexis
title: Great
content: Love these. Only complaint is I can't use them as headphones for phone calls bc other person hears echo.

author: Karin
title: Great stuff!
content: Great sound! Wonderful quality! Worth every penny!

author: George
title: Surpisingly solid
content: Was shocked to see such nice packaging for the money. A plethora of different sized silicone earpieces, but im really loving the foam tips they included. Similar to an ear plug sensation, it is very comfortable and offers great sound blocking, though any tip blocks almost all surrounding sounds regardless. Sound is phenomenal. Far above the price point. Carrying case is convenient and well constructed with premium materials. Shocked these are $15

author: Jessie
title: Who Needs BEATS?!
content: I previously had owned a pair of the infamous BEATS but sadly after a few years one ear decided to go out and I was on the hunt for a good replacement so naturally I sought out the most genuine reviews before purchasing this pair and I could not be happier. The sound quality is very loud and clear! I’ll rave about these to anyone who will listen! and if you’re someone who’s on the fence? Get off it! I promise you won’t regret buying these!

author: Chris De
title: Just OK  :-/
content:
These are "Just OK" ear buds.  I bought them for my girlfriend that wanted volume and track control ability.
However, the sound quality is nothing like the set of Sony MDR-XB50AP that I recently ordered.
the Betron packaging and presentation is nice But the Sony sound quality blows these away by an order of magnitude.

author: Reviewer_28833736272
title: Amazing!!!!
content: Really great!!!! I got these because I needed something cheap and good but it’s super awesome with its base and stuff. Only downside is that the medium sized buds are a lil too big and the small ones are way too small. So maybe my ears r weird but yeah

author: Amazon Customer
title: Performance consistent with the $100+ bracket
content:
I have no idea who this company is; I would have guessed they made toilet paper. That aside, product has to be given five stars because of the price. My only minor quibbles are that although the picture clearly shows the 3.5mm plug, the description says for iPhone; and it really isn’t for most iPhones. Secondarily, the wires are just the slightest bit thin, but they’re made from what appears to be a tangle-resistant material.

The sound is equivalent to the $100+ bracket. I’m extremely picky and occasionally an amateur audiophile. I do have a set beats pro (with a desktop amp they put 650’s to shame and I prefer the sound over qc35). Anyway, I have traditionally always purchased the $20 Skullcandy headphones with the mic. They have a much wider range and better clarity than other similarly-priced earbuds. That has changed.

These Betron YSM1000’s are simply better. They’re the best budget earbuds I’ve ever heard. While the SC earbuds might be equal for most mids, there is no comparison in depth or range. The YSM1000’s have a clear edge in lows, and an even clearer advantage in highs. Based on craftsmanship, I expect these to equal or outlast the SC’s. I have used the mic 3-4 times and have had no complaints. These are not $10 or $15 earbuds, I guarantee you that.

author: Courtney H
title: Okay, there are better headphones for the money
content: The sound quality is only okay and I don't like how these feel in my ear. Would not repurchase, but they aren't the worst headphones I've used.

author: Stump
title: Broke within 6 months; disappointing quality
content: Quality of the earbuds appears ok.  They're heavy and want to fall out of your ear from the weight.  Biggest issue? They didn't last!  I take very good care of my earbuds.  I once had a set of Sennheisers last 9 years.  These lasted a few months, the shortest duration of any earbuds I've owned.  The cabling started coming out of one of the earbuds and shorted out.  Then, it fell off.  I expected much, much better durability.  I cannot recommend these earbuds.

author: robert e.
title: Great sound quality but my left ear cartilage is sore and swollen.
content: I am a truck driver and I constantly have earbuds in. My last ones, stopped working because they were so old. I was looking for something with similar sound quality and a good price. I found what I was looking for I love the way they sound. The bad news is, that they hurt my ear cartilage so bad that I cannot wear them anymore. I will be returning them and getting a refund, and purchasing new earbuds from another company. I've tried the different attachments and nothing helps. Hoping for less pain in my ears with my next purchase.

author: Amy Rose
title: BEST customer service; high quality sound; GREAT value!!!
content:
First - these headphones are a true gem. What you get for the price (as you can read from the other reviews) is really high value.  Fair base, mids are best, and highs are decent.  One of the ear buds went out after a few months so I contacted customer service, saying how much i love the pair with the small exception of a broken bud and they sent out a new set.  No questions asked.
I would've rated these headphones 5 stars before, but with my experience and ease of replacement - it'd be nice if i could rate it higher.
Thank you Betron!

author: kevin
title: Good value
content: I love these things. They sound good and are a good value. I'm sure more expensive models may have better bass but these sound just right for watching a video or some music on the go for a great price.

author: Tat
title: Good headphone for iPhone and iPad, but not so much for Mac
content: I originally bought the headphone to be used with my MacBook Pro.  After plugging it into my Mac, I was very happy the sound quality was very good.  But when I tried to adjust the volume, the volume kept going up until the maximum.  Pressing the down button lowered the volume until it's silent completely.  Pugging it into an iPhone or iPad works just fine.  So it may be just incompatible with MacBook Pro.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing and durable!!
content: These are great! They went through the wash 3 times and the dryer twice, have been knotted and pulled more that you’d believe, and’ve kept on working as if nothing had happened! One headphone has recently stopped working but I’ve had them for 9 months already. Definitely recommend

author: Dillon Littlefield
title: Bad base. Overall mediocre.
content: Ok sound quality except for muddy base. These may sound fine depending on what you are using them for. Listening to metal is pretty bad. The plastic earbud tips are uncomfortable. I liked the foam set the best because I can actually get them to stay in my ears. Ok for an extra set of earbuds. In this case you get what you pay for.

author: Steve Capone
title: They Work! Great Deal!
content: Best ten dollars I've ever spent in electronics. I always hate when I get that new pair of earbuds+mic and within a day I can tell that the connection is shoddy and the wiring won't last. These headphones are not only not those headphones, they're downright good. And at ten dollars, I ordered two more pairs within a week of receiving the first. It's been a month now, and I have no complaints yet. I use them for many hours each day and for all of my phone calls.

author: Gaizka
title: The Top!
content: Perfect. Very satisfied with the product and service. Thank you for your help even though I lost a little money sending the other ones back.

author: geoffrey's fire tablet
title: Very Pleasantly Surprised
content: I was very pleasantly surprised by these earbuds. I needed a cheap set of earbuds to use when it really didn't matter if they were lost or damaged. These really sound good. I've been a Sennheiser guy for quite a while, their sound fits me. Sound, like beauty, is relative. People like what they like. I wasn't expecting these to sound anywhere near the way they do. I'm not saying they sound as good as my Sennheisers, but they outperformed a lot of brands costing many time over what these do. The Midrange was clean and really surprising, they actually have good Bass. The thing that shocked me the most was how loud they play. Almost every brand of earbuds recommends an amplifier, which can cost thousands of dollars. I plugged these in and actually had to turn the volume down. That really got my attention. In fact, I've even found myself reaching for these when my others were closer at hand. Wow!

author: Deedee
title: Unique headphones
content: First the presentation was nice and the box it was stored in. I was glad it came with different size ear buds because the large ones are to big for my ears. I love the color of them so no one will mistake mine for theirs. The sound is great with just the right amount of bass. I will purchase again when in need of new ones. I highly recommend 👍

author: AntonTK
title: Great Price
content: Solid buy, except mine shocked me and didn't work for a moment when first plugging in, the 3.5mm jack was also bent a bit.. Aside from the pair I received being defective, they are definitely an excellent buy. The Cable seems like it will wear quickly after a lot of use, however it doesn't tangle all that easily. The housing is kind of big (in my opinion) the stick out kind of far. The "noise Isolating" part of the buds is strictly from the Foam tips. The mic and remote work fine, small and sleek. Also For the Brand, (Betron) You should sell your other Earbuds to the U.S. really wanted the B750s or B850s

author: Daniel 3.
title: Worth the money
content: Would like a little stronger bass

author: Logan Wilder
title: Good Value
content: Good bang for the buck. Wire feels very delicate. Love the included accessories.

author: Rich
title: Best sound for the money.
content:
Very early review.  I think these are the best $13 headphones I’ve ever bought.  I don’t care if they last 6 months, still cheaper than buying a better pair with similar sound quality.

Not at all tinny like you would expect from cheap headphones, full range of bass and treble, like you would expect with headphones these days, you need to be sure to adjust the fit with the provided rubber ear adaptors to get the best sound.

Far better than skullcandy in same price ranges 16+.

I would have been happy had I bought these at 25 dollars.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointed
content: These IEM were a disappointment, even though it has a good clear sound the bass was lacking, I tested  them on my iPhone on my laptop and on my Fiio x3 and sadly had the same result on alll three. I repeat they did sound good but no bass , my Panasonic’s has three times the bass maybe I got a lemon instead of a good I doubt it . The most I can give it is a 3 our 5 it’s a shame I really liked them , they fit great and good construction, great when receiving calls good mic and clear calls

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not worth it
content: I was a big fan of these till they started dying on me for no apparent reason less than 3 months of spending my money on em. There must be a glitch with the cord because the volume decreases without pressing anything, songs play and pause all on their own, whenever the cord moves. Which is hard to avoid when you are walking and listening to music 🙈 not worth it

author: slygirlswagg
title: Exactly what I was looking for
content: perfect so far so good they were way nicer than I thought they were going to be and the packaging was really nice they sound good as well I just wanted something inexpensive that I could listen to my podcast with and I do have more expensive wireless headphones but I just wanted something easy

author: Dale F
title: Lacks bass
content: Lacks bass. Volume control easy to use. Changed the equalization for max bass and it made no di5

author: Kindle Customer
title: Just buy them.
content: I'm not by any means an audiophile, but these sound pretty freaking rad for $21. Money VERY well spent. Would definitely buy again, and I would try this Betron's other products.

author: Shikhar
title: Not impressive
content: Have been using these for a few months now, as my daily driver after my Sony MDR-XB50AP's broke. The Bertron's had good reviews and were 10 bucks cheaper but in performance, are much worse. Everything, from sound quality, bass and build quality is much worse than the Sony in my opinion. Don't get fooled by the cool design and reviews. Look elsewhere.

author: PsYcLeMaNiA
title: Fit isn't the greatest.
content: I suppose these are good enough. I use ear buds at work mostly so I have something to listen to without bothering others. I have been using Sennheiser CX300's, but when I needed some new, I tried these. I just dont like the fit. It's not so much the part that goes in your ear, it's more the size/weight of the rest of it. I think they are just too large and/or heavy, but they don't "ride" right. I practically have to remain motionless. Any movement at all and they dont stay in. Unlike the Senn's that I could run in. I'm not totally against these, but I just bought the Senn's to replace them.

author: Prunehilda
title: Literally shocking
content: Worked okay for the first week. Sound quality was okay but they kept falling out of my ears no matter what I did. After that it got worse. They started to crackle whenever I moved and not long after that began to shock me! Thankfully I was able to return for a full refund but I will not be buying Betron again.

author: Romain Chapuis
title: Can't beat the quality for the price!
content: Been an earbuds snob for years and used to spend over $100 a year on a pair that would fail. Only had these for a week but am impressed with the sound and quality on these guys. Best $14 I have spent! I already have recommended them to a few friends and will continue to do so!

author: Greatful Housemate
title: Perfect for the price
content: Was looking to have an extra pair of headphones to keep at work. These work great for the price. I typically just use the Samsung headphones that came with my phone, so I may not be a sound aficionado, but they are perfect for my purposes.

author: J. Meadows
title: You can't beat these earbuds for the price!
content:
These are an amazingly rich sounding pair of earbuds. I was blown away by the deepness of the bass. The feel and look like high quality craftsmanship was the goal.  The volume, off/on/next song switch and microphone works great with my android phone. After receiving these I immediately bought a second pair for a spare.

 "Update" Just bought a 3rd pair of these earbuds. I love them that much.

author: Jerrica Paulsen
title: Great Headphones - Superior Quality - Great Price
content: Headphones were reasonable but very easily compared to high quality, costly headphones. I would highly suggest these as they work just as good as the expensive ones and last long and have better quality than the cheap ones.

author: Sydney
title: Not the best ever but best bang for your buck no doubt!
content: These are fantastic for <$20 headphones. I bought two pair when I first got them and could not be happier. I will buy again. Sound quality is good and they are robust and mostly well built. The little aesthetic screen thing on the back of one came off but who cares about that. Also the cord will break at some point but honestly I am happy if corded headphones last a few months I put a lot of wear on cords so they always break even at a >$90 price point.

author: Erin
title: Great quality for the price
content:
I have an even greater appreciation for my favorite songs and I love the bass. Cancels out noise fairly well but not completely.
However, I do have issues with semi-frequent static and have to adjust the angle of the cord. It's turned itself up or down when this happens sometimes. Honestly, I think it's worth these minor inconveniences. I'd recommend these earbuds.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Well built
content: Good sounding. All around well built except for the mesh on the earpiece which seems to be glued in which can be the first thing to fall but nothing that can’t be fixed. Another things is the size of the earpiece, since it is big, if not properly placed it will cause discomfort. Other than that, beatiful thing, love the cable and gold touch.

author: ilovemoo2
title: Amazing quality!
content:
The sound and material quality is so nice that my husband keeps stealing them so now I will have to buy another pair just for him lol

My favorite brands in the past have been skull candy and bose. I feel the overall balance is very nice, the bass is there but you can still appreciate every other piece of the music as well which is nice.

I do happen to have smaller ears and wish that the small size marshmallows were just a tiny bit smaller but this is a common thing I run into anyway.

I’ve owned these for a few weeks now and have noticed no deterioration in music quality or on the outer materials.

They also include a mic so you can take calls or use them as a headset to play games with friends.

author: JayRay91
title: Hollow sounding
content: Was hopeful for these headphones based on other reviews, however the sound quality is noticeably hollow sounding. The bass is good, but something weird is going on with the mid-range sound. I sounds like a hollow can sound. I will not be using these to listen to music, they are harsh sounding to my ears. Maybe I got a lemon, I don't know. Only positive marks are the build quality.

author: 007brendan
title: Looks great.  Sound is below average
content:
These headphones look great.  They have a stylish, thick, heavy cord that resists tangling.  The earbuds fit well and have a nice retro look to them.  The plug is made entirely of metal and appears to be pretty durable.

However, they don't sound very good at all.  I'd wager my $7 pair of skullcandy earbuds sound better.  I'm planning to use them mostly for video conferencing, so the sound quality doesn't really need to be that great. Hopefully the microphone is half-decent, but I don't have high hopes.

author: Rick Rhody
title: The right earbud stopped working within 2 days of use
content: The right earbud suddenly stopped working after using these headphones for 2 days. Probably only used for about 35-40 minutes total during those 2 days. Extremely disappointed in this purchase.

author: ruben kincaid
title: Volume adjusts on it's own.
content: The sound and build quality is great, however whenever the volume adjustment lightly brushes against my shirt it turns the volume down. Not sure if it's static or what, kind of a let down.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Trash
content: They are really cute. Too heavy to stay in your ear. don't waste your money.

author: Tobie
title: Ear pieces too large.
content: The earphones look terrific.  However, the rubber ear pieces are so large that you would have to be a gorilla to wear them.  I returned mine and got another brand.

author: Tia C Tyson
title: Don't believe the hype
content: I got my headphones like three month's ago.  They were working fine until I wore them on top of my wool jacket.  Static shock from my jacket caused my headphones to start acting funny.
